<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PX DOUBLE; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 9%" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	27,052
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4PX; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<TABLE ID="ZB157BFB7B25845808DFBF9481D652A33" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	NOTE 10:-
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	LOAN AND CREDIT LINES
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	In 2011 the Company entered into a loan agreement with Bank Hapoalim Ltd. (the "Loan Agreement") for a loan in the principal amount of $&#160;35,000 (the "Loan").
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The Loan Agreement provides that the principal amount of $&#160;35,000 bear effective interest at a rate of Libor + 3.15%, which Libor is updated every three months. The principal amount is to be repaid in 17 quarterly installments from February 19, 2012, through February 19, 2016 and the interest is to be paid in quarterly payments starting as of February 19, 2011. As of December 31, 2014 and 2015 the accrued interest is $38 and $&#160;18, respectively, and is recorded as part of the accrued expenses.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The loan is secured by a floating charge over all Company assets as well as several customary fixed charges on specific assets and subject to certain financial covenants, as further described below.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The maturities of the principal amount for period after December 31, 2015 are $ 2,072.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	In March 2013, the Company was provided with a Credit Facility by four financial institutions. The credit facility provided the Company with revolving credit facilities, under which a sum of up to $&#160;40,200 in the form of bank guarantees and $&#160;73,500 in the form of loans was available. The new agreement replaced all of the Company's previously existing credit facilities, including the loan agreement (with respect to the Loan provides the same interest and repayment installments set forth in the Loan Agreement). Each portion of the Credit Facility was operated by its furnishing financial institution.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Borrowings and repayments were made directly with the relevant financial institution. Any amounts repaid during the term of the Credit Facility were available for re-borrowing up to the amount available under the loan segment of the Credit Facility. In the framework of the Credit Facility, the Company undertook certain financial and other covenants. The Credit Facility was set to be terminated, and all borrowings set to l be repaid, on March 14, 2016.
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 100%">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
	F - 33
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" SIZE="3" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage137"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	CERAGON NETWORKS LTD. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV>
<HR STYLE="BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" ALIGN="CENTER" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	U.S. dollars in thousands
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<TABLE ID="Z660A9F4D47C944AC80FF44CDF273C2B5" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	NOTE 10:-
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	LOAN AND CREDIT LINES (Cont.)
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Repayment could have been accelerated by the financial institutions in certain events of default including in insolvency events, failure to comply with financial covenants or an event in which a current or future shareholder acquires control (as defined under the Israel Securities Law) of the Company.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	During the first quarter of 2014 the Company amended its Credit Facility arrangements to adjust the financial covenants and applicable interest rates and fees.. According to the amendment, the available loan facilities were reduced by $&#160;5,000 on January 1, 2015 and by an additional $&#160;5,000 on April 1, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	On March 31, 2015 the Company signed a further amendment to its agreement with the four financial institutions to better align its credit facility terms to its current needs and to adjust the financial covenants and applicable interest rates and fees. The main changes consisted of:
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="ZF40F47DC775F47DBBCC1325D242E92CC" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 58.5PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 27PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160; a.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	An increase in the allowed discounting activities of one of the Company&#8217;s main customers' long-term receivables to $&#160;54,000 and additional $ 20,000 for other customers.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="Z17C55C094F9043FD91F5E8BB24490BF1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 58.5PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 27PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160; b.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Gradual reduction of the credit facility for loans from $ 63, 500 (starting April 1, 2015) to $&#160;50,000 by February 28, 2016.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="Z433C3B7EAAE94B83A3F5684496F06A90" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 27PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160; c.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Gradual reduction in minimum cash covenant from $ 20,000 to $ 15,000 by October 1, 2015.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="Z3101308E062E40488713FACA5976EF27" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0">

	&#160; d.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	An extension of the credit facility repayment date to June 30, 2016 (from March, 14, 2016).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="ZCA736FC6E87F43CFB68B568BA8FB0E63" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0">

	&#160; e.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Changes in the equity related covenants definition to exclude Goodwill and Intangible Assets from the calculation, as well as reduction for the minimum total shareholders&#8217; equity value to $ 85,000 and reduction of the minimum total shareholders&#8217; equity total assets ratio 0.27.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="ZBAC29F5267924455B03EB13C3A30EC36" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0">

	&#160; f.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Other changes primarily increase in the maximum spread of interest chargeable to 3.5% and other bank fees.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	In March 2016 the Company signed a further amendment to its agreement with the four financial institutions to extend the credit facility repayment date to March 31, 2017 (from June 30, 2016).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	As of December 31, 2015 the Company utilized $&#160;34,922 out of $&#160;56,000 of available credit lines from several banks. The credit lines carry interest rates in the range of Libor+3.5% and Libor+3.75%.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	As of December 31, 2014, the Company had outstanding forward exchange contracts designated as cash flow hedge for the acquisition of NIS 116,942 in consideration for $&#160;29,987 maturing in a period of up to one year. As of December 31, 2015, the Company had outstanding forward
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	exchange contracts designated as cash flow hedge for the acquisition of NIS 122,407 in consideration for $&#160;31,686 maturing, in a period of up to one year.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	As of December 31, 2014, the Company recorded accumulated unrealized gain in other comprehensive income, in the amount of $&#160;100. As of December 31, 2015, the Company recorded accumulated unrealized loss in other comprehensive income in the amount of $&#160;163, from its forward contracts with respect to anticipated payroll payment.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The Company also enters into forward exchange contracts to hedge a portion of its certain monetary items in the balance sheet, such as trade receivables and trade payables denominated in foreign currencies for a period of up to one month (the "Fair Value Hedging Program"). The purpose of the Company's Fair Value Hedging Program is to protect the fair value of the monetary assets from foreign exchange rates fluctuations. Gains and losses from derivatives related to the Fair Value Hedging Program are not designated as hedging instruments. In 2013 and 2014 the Company recorded financial expenses in the amount of $ 2,150 and $ 240, respectively, in relation to the Fair Value Hedging Program. In 2015, the Company recorded financial income in the amount of $705 in relation to the Fair Value Hedging Program.
</DIV>
<EFX_INCOME_STATEMENT>

<DIV>
<TABLE ID="Z437C2AC1EFF64865A78F9AB5193FA720" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	NOTE 12:-
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	PENSION LIABILITIES, NET
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The Norwegian subsidiary Ceragon Networks AS (formerly "Nera Networks AS") has defined contribution schemes and 4 unfunded pension plans.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Under the defined contributions scheme Ceragon Networks AS makes a payment to the insurance company who administer the fund on behalf of the employee. Ceragon Networks AS has no liabilities relating to such schemes after the payment to the insurance company. As of December 31, 2015 almost all active employees are in this scheme. The contribution and the corresponding social security taxes are recognized as payroll expenses in the period to which the employee's services are rendered. The defined pension contribution schemes meet the requirements of the law on compulsory occupational pension.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Defined benefit scheme was stopped for admission from December 1, 2007, and persons that were employed after that date were automatically entered into the defined contribution scheme. The schemes give right to defined future benefits. These are mainly dependent on the number of qualifying employment years, salary level at pension age, and the amount of benefits from the national insurance scheme. The commitment related to the pension scheme is covered through an insurance company. As of December 31, 2015 the pension scheme has 0 members.
</DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	AFP-scheme - in force from 1 January 2011, the AFP-scheme is a defined benefit multi-enterprise scheme, but is recognized in the accounts as a defined contribution scheme until reliable and sufficient information is available for the group to recognize its proportional share of pension cost, pension liability and pension funds in the scheme. Ceragon Networks AS's
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	liabilities are therefore not recognized as liability in the balance sheet.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 100%">
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
	F - 36
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	NOTE 12:-
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The liabilities in respect of Ceragon Networks AS's pension plans have been recalculated based on updated employee numbers as at December 31, 2015. These plans together represent 100% of the PBO of the entire group.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

	&#160;

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Rate of compensation increase
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>

	3.25
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	%
</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The amounts reported for net periodic pension costs and the respective benefit obligation amounts are dependent upon the actuarial assumptions used. The Company reviews historical trends, future expectations, current market conditions and external data to determine the assumptions. The discount rate is the covered bond.&#160;&#160;For purposes of calculating the 2016 net periodic benefit cost and the 2015 benefit obligation, the Company has used a discount rate of&#160;&#160;2.7%.&#160;&#160;The rate of compensation increase is determined by the Company, based upon its long-term plans for such increases.
</DIV>

	Regarding the policy for amortizing actuarial gains or losses for pension and post-employment plans, the Company has chosen to charge the actuarial gains or losses to statement of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	For the years ended December&#160;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015, an actuarial gain (loss) of $&#160;(1,291), $&#160;(533) and $&#160;174, respectively, was recognized in statements of income (loss).
</DIV>

	Expenses for lease of facilities for the years ended December 31, 2013, 2014 and 2015 were approximately $&#160;8,182, $&#160;5,426 and $ 3,797, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

	Expenses for the lease of motor vehicles for the years ended December 31, 2013, 2014 and 2015 were approximately $&#160;1,568, $&#160;1,174 and $&#160;1,175, respectively.
</DIV>

	b.

<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	During 2014 and 2015, the Company received several grants from the OCS. The grants require the Company to comply with the requirements of the Research and Development Law, however, the Company is not obligated to pay royalties on sales of products based on technology or know how developed from the grants. In a case involving the transfer of technology or know how developed from the grants outside of Israel, the Company may be required to pay royalties related to past sales of products based on the technology or the developed know how. The Company recorded income from OCS grants for the years ended December 31, 2013, 2014 and 2015 in the amount of $ 599, $ 1,092 and $ 1,318, respectively.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

	As of December 31, 2014 and 2015, the Company provided bank guarantees in an aggregate amount of $&#160;27,890 and $&#160;25,410, respectively, with respect to tender offer guarantees and performance guarantees to its customers.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 100%">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">

	F - 39
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" SIZE="3" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage143"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	CERAGON NETWORKS LTD. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV>
<HR STYLE="BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" ALIGN="CENTER" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	U.S. dollars in thousands
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="ZC401D3039B864510AE5BA30D339A115F" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	NOTE 13:-
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENT LIABILITIES (Cont.)
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
<TABLE ID="Z6726920AF44D4CD79CE6B72E6BD097CC" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 9PT" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 9PT" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63PT">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 27PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	d.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Litigations:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The Company is currently involved in various claims and legal proceedings. The Company reviews the status of each matter and assesses its potential financial exposure. If the potential loss from any claim or legal proceeding is considered probable and the amount can be reasonably estimated, the Company accrues a liability for the estimated loss.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	On January 6, 2015 the Company was served with a motion to approve a purported class action, naming the Company, its Chief Executive Officer and its directors as defendants. The motion was filed with the District Court of Tel-Aviv. The purported class action alleges breaches of duties by making false and misleading statements in the Company&#8217;s SEC filings and public statements. The Company filed its defense on June 21, 2015 and the parties are now debating the plaintiffs&#8217; right for discovery. The Company filed its response to the plaintiffs&#8217; request for discovery on January 25, 2016 and the plaintiffs submitted their response on February 24 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Once the court decides in relation to discovery, it is expected that a date for submission of plaintiff&#8217;s response to the Company&#8217;s defense will be set. The initial procedure, i.e. until the District Court decides whether to approve the motion or to deny it, has been conducted for over a year now, and it is difficult to estimate how long it is expected to last. The Company believes that the District Court should deny the motion. There is no assurance that the Company&#8217;s position will be accepted by the District Court. In such case the Company may have to divert attention of its executives to deal with this class action as well as incur expenses that may be beyond its insurance coverage for such cases, which cause a risk of loss and expenditures that may adversely affect its financial condition and results of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The Company believes it has strong defense claims and intends to vigorously defend its position. The Company cannot assess the outcome of this claim due its early stage. Therefore the company did not record a provision as of December 31, 2015
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<TABLE ID="ZE4D3ADF823CB484D986F093C7ED59BAD" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63PT">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 27PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	e.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Inventory:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

	&#160;
</DIV>

	The Group is obligated under certain agreement with its supplier to purchase specified item of excess inventory which is expected to be utilized during the years 2016-2018. As of December 31, 2015, non-cancelable purchase obligations were approximately
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	$
</FONT>
	1,638
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

	a.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">

</DIV>

	The ordinary shares entitle their holders to receive notice to participate and vote in general meetings of the Company, the right to share in distributions upon liquidation of the Company, and to receive dividends, if declared.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<TABLE ID="Z0DA5DF794EC94CA199758770DC871F99" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63PT">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 27PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	b.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In November 2013, the Company completed a public offering of its shares on NASDAQ. The Company issued 14,000,000 of its ordinary shares, nominal value NIS 0.01 per share
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	at a price of $&#160;2.40 per share before issuance expenses. The Company also granted to the underwriters the option to purchase up to 1,600,000 additional ordinary shares within 30 days, which was fully exercised. Total net proceeds from the issuance amounted to approximately $&#160;34,959, net of issuance expenses in the amount of $&#160;361.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63PT">

<TD>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	In August 2014, the Company completed a public offering of its shares on NASDAQ. The Company issued 21,250,000 of its ordinary shares, nominal value NIS 0.01 per share at a price of $&#160;1.89 per share before issuance expenses. The Company also granted to the underwriters the option to purchase up to 2,850,000 additional ordinary shares within 30 days, which was fully exercised. Total net proceeds from the issuance amounted to approximately $&#160;45,149, net of issuance expenses in the amount of $&#160;400.
</DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<TABLE ID="Z5A1A45F3AD644ADAB8BA7B3FE9972143" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63PT">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 27PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	c.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Stock options plans:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="Z1DAEA321AD53498EA1937C23CAA19E0D" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 85.05PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160; 1.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In 2003, the Company adopted a share option plan (the "Plan"). Under the Plan, options may be granted to officers, directors, employees and consultants of the Company or its subsidiaries. The options vest primarily over four years. The options expire ten years from the date of grant. In December 2012, the Company extended the term of the Plan for an additional period of ten years.Upon adoption of the Plan, the Company reserved for issuance 8,639,000 ordinary shares in accordance with the respective terms thereof. Any options, which are canceled or forfeited before the expiration date, become available for future grants. As of December 31, 2015, the Company has 1,884,425 Ordinary shares available for future grant under the Plan.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="Z2A1D346025E14040A37C4FAB2E4A61C7" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 85.05PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">

	&#160;&#160;2.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On September 6, 2010, the Company's board of directors amended the Plan so as to enable to grant Restricted share Units ("RSUs") pursuant to such Plan.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	99
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4PX; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The Company's options are generally granted at exercise prices which are equal to the average market value of the ordinary shares in the period of 30 trading days prior to the grant date. The weighted average grant date fair value of the options granted during 2013, 2014 and 2015 were $&#160;1.99, $&#160;0.96 and $&#160;0.54, respectively. No RSUs were granted during 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The aggregate intrinsic value in the table above represents the total intrinsic value (the difference between the Company's closing stock price on the last trading day of the year and the exercise price, multiplied by the number of in-the-money options) that would have been received by the option holders had all option holders exercised their options on the last day of the year.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	This amount is impacted by the changes in the fair market value of the Company's shares. Total intrinsic value of options and RSUs exercised during the years ended December 31, 2014 and 2015 were $&#160;573 and $&#160;480, respectively. As of December 31, 2015, there was $&#160;1,049 of total unrecognized compensation cost related to non-vested share-based compensation arrangements granted under the Plan. This cost is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average period of 0.92 years.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

	F - 42

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	CERAGON NETWORKS LTD. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV>
<HR STYLE="BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" ALIGN="CENTER" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

	U.S. dollars in thousands

</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">

</DIV>
</TD>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

</DIV>

	In the event that cash dividends are declared in the future, such dividends will be paid in NIS or in foreign currency subject to any statutory limitations. The Company does not intend to pay cash dividends in the foreseeable future.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: BLOCK; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<TABLE ID="Z1EDC0A8BD16044309D66C6A64E08B82F" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 63PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	NOTE 15:-
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: BLOCK; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	TAXES ON INCOME
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<TABLE ID="ZC583646B6A354CF99C78F8E6E5E0EDC6" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63PT">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 27PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	a.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Israeli taxation:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<TABLE ID="ZDBED9A47B5A14E6CB9BDC3C1C79E671C" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 90PT">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 27PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	1.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Measurement of taxable income:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 117PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The Company has elected to file its tax return under the Israeli Income Tax Regulations 1986 (Principles Regarding the Management of Books of Account of Foreign Invested Companies and Certain Partnerships and the Determination of Their Taxable Income). Accordingly, starting tax year 2003, results of operations in Israel are measured in terms of earnings in U.S. dollar.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<TABLE ID="Z2F086CE15354488580D404F7E9CB81BF" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 90PT">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 27PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	2.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Tax benefits under the Law for the Encouragement of Capital Investments, 1959 (the "Law"):
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 117PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	According to the Law, the Company is entitled to various tax benefits by virtue of the "approved enterprise" and/or " Benefited enterprise" status granted to part of their enterprises, as implied by this Law. The principal benefits by virtue of the Law are:
</DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 117PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	According to the provisions of the Law, the Company has chosen to enjoy the "Alternative" track. Under this track, the Company is tax exempt in the first two years of the benefit period and subject to tax at the reduced rate of 10%-25% for the remaining benefit period.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 117PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	For receiving the benefits under the alternative track, there is a minimum qualifying investment. This condition requires an investment in the acquisition of productive assets such as machinery and equipment which must be carried out within three years.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 117PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The minimum qualifying investment required for setting up a plant is NIS 300 thousand. As for plant expansions, the minimum qualifying investment is the higher of NIS 300 thousand and an amount equivalent to the "qualifying percentage" of the value of the productive assets. Productive assets that are used by the plant but not owned by it will also be viewed as productive assets. The Company was eligible under the terms of minimum qualifying investment and elected 2006 and 2009 as its "years of election".
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 100%">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
	F - 44
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" SIZE="3" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage148"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	U.S. dollars in thousands
</DIV>

	&#160;
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	NOTE 15:-
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	TAXES ON INCOME (Cont.)
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 117PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The qualifying percentage of the value of the productive assets is as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 117PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<TABLE ID="Z143DAC7418834C979C6F3F650BA20DCA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 86%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2PX SOLID; WIDTH: 68%" VALIGN="TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The value of productive
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	assets before the expansion
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	(NIS in millions)
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 4%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2PX SOLID; WIDTH: 28%" VALIGN="TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The new proportion that the
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	required investment bears to the
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	value of productive assets
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 68%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 4%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 28%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&#160;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 68%" VALIGN="TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Up to NIS 140
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 4%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28%" VALIGN="TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	12%
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="WHITE">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 68%" VALIGN="TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	NIS 140 - NIS 500
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 4%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28%" VALIGN="TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	7%
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 68%" VALIGN="TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	More than NIS 500
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 4%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28%" VALIGN="TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	5%
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 117PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The income qualifying for tax benefits under the alternative track is the taxable income of a company that has met certain conditions as determined by the Law ("a Benefited company"), and which is derived from an industrial enterprise. The Law specifies the types of qualifying income that is entitled to tax benefits under the alternative track with respect of an industrial enterprise, whereby income from an industrial enterprise includes, among others, revenues from the production and development of software products and revenues from industrial research and development activities performed for a foreign resident (and approved by the Head of the Administration of Industrial Research and Development).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 117PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The benefit period starts with the first year the Benefited enterprise earns taxable income, provided that 14 years have not passed since the approval was granted and 12 years have not passed since the enterprise began operating. In respect of expansion programs pursuant to Amendment No. 60 to the Law, the benefit period starts at the later of the year elected and the first year the Company earns taxable income provided that 12 years have not passed since the beginning of the year of election. The respective benefit period has not yet begun.
</DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 117PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The above benefits are conditional upon the fulfillment of the conditions stipulated by the Law, regulations published thereunder and th+e letters of approval for the investments in the approved enterprises, as above. Non-compliance with the conditions may cancel all or part of the benefits and refund of the amount of the benefits, including interest. As of December 31, 2015, the management believes that the Company is in compliance with all of the aforementioned conditions.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 117PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The Company is also a "foreign investors' company", as defined by the Capital Investments Law, and, as such, is entitled to a 10-year period of benefits and may be entitled to reduced tax rates of between 10% to 25% (depending on the percentage of foreign ownership in each tax year).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 117PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The Company has three capital investment programs that have been granted approved enterprise status, under the Law and two programs under beneficiary enterprise status pursuant to the Amended Legislation.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 100%">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
	F - 45
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" SIZE="3" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage149"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	CERAGON NETWORKS LTD. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV>
<HR STYLE="BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" ALIGN="CENTER" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	U.S. dollars in thousands
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="ZB78282E98ED6477CAABC96C3EBDF526C" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	NOTE 15:-
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	TAXES ON INCOME (Cont.)
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Income from sources other than the "Approved Enterprise" and " Benefited Enterprise" during the benefit period will be subject to the tax at the regular tax rate.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Amendment to the Law for the Encouragement of Capital Investments, 1959 (Amendment 68):
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Effective January 1, 2011, the "Knesset" (Israeli Parliament) enacted the Law for Economic Policy for 2011 and 2012 (Amended Legislation), and among other things, amended the Law, ("the Amendment"). According to the Amendment, the benefit tracks in the Investment Law were modified and a flat tax rate applies to the Company's entire preferred income. The Company will be able to opt to apply (the waiver is non-recourse) the Amendment and from then on it will be subject to the amended tax rates as follows: 2011 and 2012 - 15%, 2013 and 2014 - 12.5% and in 2015 and thereafter - 12%.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Amendment to the Law for the Encouragement of Capital Investments, 1959 (Amendment 71):
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	On August 5, 2013, the "Knesset" issued the Law for Changing National Priorities (Legislative Amendments for Achieving Budget Targets for 2013 and 2014), 2013 which consists of Amendment 71 to the Law for the Encouragement of Capital Investments ("the Amendment"). According to the Amendment, the tax rate on preferred income form a preferred enterprise in 2014 and thereafter will be 16% (in development area A - 9%).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The Amendment also prescribes that any dividends distributed to individuals or foreign residents from the preferred enterprise's earnings as above will be subject to tax at a rate of 20%.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 117PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Company has evaluated the effect of the adoption of the Amendment on its financial statements, and as of the date of the approval of the financial statements, the Company believes that it will not apply the Amendment. Accordingly, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Company has not adjusted its deferred tax balances as of December 31, 2015. The Company may change its position in the future.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<TABLE ID="Z01F01054F5684C37B190556200454BF2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63PT">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 27PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	3.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Tax benefits under the Law for the Encouragement of Industry (Taxes), 1969:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The Encouragement Law provides several tax benefits for industrial companies. An industrial company is defined as a company resident and located in Israel, at least 90% of the income of which in a given tax year exclusive of income from specified Government loans, capital gains, interest and dividends, is derived from an industrial enterprise owned by it. An industrial enterprise is defined as an enterprise whose major activity in a given tax year is industrial production activity.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 100%">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
	F - 46
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" SIZE="3" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage150"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	CERAGON NETWORKS LTD. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV>
<HR STYLE="BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: AUTO; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" ALIGN="CENTER" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	U.S. dollars in thousands
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="ZC9BAABDCD0464721937B4FE6D56F6596" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	NOTE 15:-
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	TAXES ON INCOME (Cont.)
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Management believes that the Company is currently qualified as an "industrial company" under the Encouragement Law and, as such, enjoys tax benefits, including: (1) deduction of purchase of know-how and patents and/or right to use a patent over an eight-year period; (2) the right to elect, under specified conditions, to file a consolidated tax return with additional related Israeli industrial companies and an industrial holding company; (3) accelerated depreciation rates on equipment and buildings; and (4) expenses related to a public offering on the Tel-Aviv Stock Exchange and on recognized stock markets outside of Israel, are deductible in equal amounts over three years.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 437PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Eligibility for benefits under the Encouragement Law is not subject to receipt of prior approval from any Governmental authority. No assurance can be given that the Israeli tax authorities will agree that the Company qualifies, or, if the Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	qualifies, that the Company will continue to qualify as an industrial company or that the benefits described above will be available to the Company in the future.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<TABLE ID="ZE0DCFADF53A84FF0AD3E554FEA127350" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63PT">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 27PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	4.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Tax rates:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	Taxable income of Israeli companies is subject to tax at the rate of 26.5% in the years ended December 31, 2014 and 2015
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	On January 4, 2016, the Israeli Parliament (the Knesset) approved the second and third readings of the amendment to the Income Tax Ordinance (Num 217), lowering the Israeli corporate tax rate from 26.5% to 25%.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	The effective tax rate payable by a company which is taxed under the Investment Law may be considerably lower (see also Note 15.a2 above).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<TABLE ID="Z80A8F4A53A9742269906D56E283F3FF7" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">

	Deferred income taxes reflect the net tax effects of temporary differences between the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities for financial reporting purposes and the amounts used for income tax purposes.

<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PX DOUBLE; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	$
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PX DOUBLE; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 9%" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	1,822
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4PX; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	&#160;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In assessing the realization of deferred tax assets, management considers whether it is more likely than not that all or some portion of the deferred tax assets will not be realized in each tax jurisdiction. The ultimate realization of the deferred tax assets is dependent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	upon the generation of future taxable income during the periods in which temporary differences are deductible and net operating losses are utilized. Based on consideration of these factors, the Company recorded a valuation allowance amounting $&#160;108,292 and $ 97,899 at December 31, 2014 and 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

	d.

</TD>

	The Company has accumulated net operating losses and capital loss for Israeli income tax purposes as of December 31, 2015 in the amount of approximately $ 198,760 and $&#160;7,987, respectively. The net operating losses may be carried forward and offset against taxable income in the future for an indefinite period.

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>

	TAXES ON INCOME (Cont.)
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	As of December 31, 2015, the Company's U.S. subsidiary had a U.S. federal net operating loss carry forward of approximately&#160;$&#160;1,400 that can be carried forward and offset against taxable income and that expires during the years 2017 to 2026. Utilization of U.S. net operating losses may be subject to substantial annual limitations due to the "change in ownership" provisions of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and similar state law provisions. The annual limitations may result in the expiration of net operating losses before utilization.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	As of December 31, 2015, the Company's Norwegian subsidiary had a net operating loss carry forward of approximately $&#160;12,600 that can be carried forward. The net operating losses may be carried forward and offset against taxable income in the future for an indefinite period.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	As of December 31, 2015, the Company's Brazilian subsidiary had a net operating loss carryforward of approximately $&#160;9,500 that can be carried forward. The net operating losses may be carried forward and offset against taxable income in the future for an indefinite period. The offset is limited to a maximum 30% of the annual taxable income.
</DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

	In 2015 the Company had revenue from a single customer group of affiliated companies equaling 17.7% of total revenues.

<TD>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The amounts for the years ended December 2014 and 2015 include expenses of $&#160;20,452 and $1,634, respectively resulting from the devaluation of the local currency in Venezuela, pursuant to SICAD II, and the related re-measurement of certain assets denominated in or linked to the U.S. dollar due to restrictive government policies on payments in foreign currency. In addition for the year ended December 31, 2014 this amount also includes $&#160;2,170 related to certain transactions to expatriate cash from Venezuela and Argentina.
</DIV>
